content: Usually, this appears when Thunderbird senses that you are offline. Check File>offline to verify. Once online, the 'send' button should appear.
creator: davidsk

content: In setup, I suggest NOT entering password until Gmail asks for it. Leave it blank in setup screen. On addressbook, just click tools>import>import from a file and follow the menus until the 'sqlite' option appears and then click and select the abook.sqlite file from old profile.
creator: davidsk

content:
You reference appdata\local. Did you mean appdata\roaming? It appears you copied the entire profile, not just local folders. Please review the file locations you used. Normally, for local folders, I would do your basic steps but would copy 

c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird\profiles\<profilename>\Mail\Local Folders to D:

and on restart to adjust the Local Folders pointer to poing to D and then delete the folder contents on C:
creator: davidsk

content: Have you tried moving the entries from Storage.sbd to Local Folders and restarting Thunderbird?
creator: davidsk

content: That did it! Thank you so much. Strange that in exporting my old profile, that Thunderbird moved the files to this odd and ineffective place.

content: You are referring to https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1477189. Let's continue there.
creator: wsmwk

content:
There are several possibilities.

  1. it may be that your configuration setup is wrong, causing the error
  2. or it may be that the account requires an 'app' password, such as Gmail requires.
  3. it might be timing issue. (I always suggest NOT entering password during setup until the account prompts for it)
  4. or it sometimes happens when users enter only part of their email id, omitting the @ and all to the right of it.
creator: davidsk

content:
Informazioni utili da fornire nelle richieste al forum:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
creator: @next

content:
Se pensi che la password memorizzata in Thunderbird sia sbagliata, eliminala seguendo questa guida -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/salvare-password-thunderbird#w_come-rimuovere-o-modificare-le-password

Riavvia Thunderbird ed alla prima connessione ti verr√† chiesto di inserire una nuova password.

content: Yes, just highlight the trash folder, rightclick the message and select 'move to' and select desired folder.
creator: davidsk

content:
Hi Stephen,

  1. Account settings (in the folder pane, right click on the account and select "Settings")
  2. Click on the account that you want to remove.
  3. Use on "Account Actions" below the list of accounts.
  4. Select "Remove Account".

Rick
